utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Whitney Williams, 22. She went into convulsions on the E train. In and out of consciousness ever since.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: I want a CBC and an EKG. Any sign of drugs on her?

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Nothing. But at one point she said that someone did this to her.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Whitney. Can you tell me what happened?

utterance.speaker: WHITNEY WILLIAMS
utterance.content: Diamondback.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: She’s seizing. Push 4 milligrams Ativan.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Friends. Thank you for coming on such short notice. It’s times like these that I’m reminded of Shakespeare, who wrote: “It’s not in the stars – “

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Ah ha ha. He also said, "brevity is the soul of wit”, so get to it, darling.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. We just returned from the Hamptons. And –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got married!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We got married!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You guys suck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What – why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hold – hold up. No, no, no, no, no. You guys jumped the broom and didn’t invite us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was spur of the moment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Spur.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, and it was perfection. I mean, you should have been there. It was fire and love and at one point there were all these doves that just soared into the –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram. Gram, maybe we don’t rub it in. Let’s go get you another drink.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Drink. Okay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hold this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I am your maid of honor. I haven’t had a carb in months, just in case I had to put that damn dress back on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you look great.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Save the flattery. Kate, you owe me dinner. I’m picking the restaurant and we’re ordering all the desserts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh girl, you’re married! Come here!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. We were really looking forward to this for a long time too, Castle. We had a speech prepared and everything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Plus we wrote that song.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You wrote a song? We’re planning a little reception. You guys could do the song at the reception.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You had your chance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No song for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, we’re going to have to cut the celebration short. There’s been a murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? We didn’t get that call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Once again, not invited. Cheers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. We’ll meet you at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it could have been worse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It still might be. I mean, who knows what they’re doing to our place right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hear what you just said?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our place. Our. We’re married. We’re married. We did it, Mrs. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We certainly did, Mr. Beckett. Although, this arguably isn’t the most romantic post-wedding activity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or, perhaps it’s fitting, considering how we met. But you bring up an excellent point. The honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. About the exotic island getaway. It’s going to have to wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because when you went missing I used up all of my vacation days … looking for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So no honeymoon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not for a while, I’m afraid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So instead of mai tais … we get murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. No, it’ll be great.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Whitney Williams. She went into convulsions and cardiac arrest. We couldn’t bring her back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And her last words were ‘diamondback’? What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And she believed she was a victim of foul play?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Yes, and so do I. We ran a full blood workup and it came back with high traces of digoxin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a heart medication.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Derived from the foxglove plant. According to our pathologist, this was unpurified digoxin. Taken directly from the plant? It’s lethal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was poisoned. Any way to tell how long ago she ingested the foxglove?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: We’re estimating 10 to 14 hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you contacted the next of kin?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: I thought you would want to handle that. This is her in case of emergency card.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thanks for coming in, Mr. and Mrs. Dagmar.

utterance.speaker: PHILIP DAGMAR
utterance.content: Well, since her mom passed I suppose we’re the closest thing to family that Whitney has.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE DAGMAR
utterance.content: She was our first Dagmar scholar.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dagmar scholar?

utterance.speaker: PHILIP
utterance.content: We sponsor disadvantaged children. Send them to the finest schools.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The poisoning occurred ten to fourteen hours ago. Do you happen to know where Whitney was or who she was with at the time?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE
utterance.content: No. The last time we saw her was a week ago when she came over for supper.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did she mention if she was having problems with anyone? Perhaps at work?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE
utterance.content: She did say she was going to take some time off from her internship.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE
utterance.content: Her mother’s death was recent. Whitney needed some time to get over the loss.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does the word ‘diamondback’ mean anything to either of you?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: PHILIP
utterance.content: No, I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. ‘Diamondback.’ I’ve whittled it down to three possibilities as to what that means and why Whitney would utter it with her dying breath.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I am sure that none of them will be a waste of my time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Possibility number one: it’s the password for a murderous, underground snake handling fight club. Granted, that’s probably not what it means, but it might be the basis for my next Nikki Heat novel. Possibility number two: she was killed by the Marvel character Diamondback, whose special skill was throwing diamond-shaped spikes filled with poison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Third possibility –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was a dude ranch in Arizona.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We struck out with the Dagmars, but we found an email to Whitney from a Diamondback Old West Ranch confirming a two week stay in bunkhouse number 14.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Old west dude ranch. That’s my number three. It’s exactly what I was going to say. Good work, boys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You still suck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you owe us for those tuxedo rentals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was on vacation in Arizona for two weeks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she go with anyone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but it looks like the city slickers/cowboy thing didn’t really agree with her. Whitney cut her trip short. After only three days there she paid for a last minute ticket change for an 8 AM flight out of Phoenix this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This morning? So she was poisoned in Arizona. Somewhere between 1 and 5 AM local time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And all indications are that she left in a big hurry. She even forgot to turn in her bunkhouse key.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I need every detail we can get on that place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, according to this, Diamondback Old West Ranch is “a living history resort where both staff and guest dress in old west attire and engage in cowboy activities”. This sounds pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or not, considering Whitney might have been poisoned there. Wait a minute. If Whitney flew back today, then she was coming in on the E train from JFK when she had that seizure. But the only personal effect that we found at the hospital was her purse. So where’s her luggage?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe it was left on the subway when the medics took her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, something happened at that ranch and there might be evidence of it in her suitcases.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll look into it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And I’ll keep looking into her financials. Maybe there’s somewhere else she went in Arizona.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I’ll touch base with the local sheriff and coordinate with him on the investigation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks, big boy.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Look, Detective, the way I see it, this is not an Arizona matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sheriff, we have evidence that Whitney was poisoned in your jurisdiction.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: No, what you have is speculation. She could have been poisoned on the plane, or at the airport. Hell, I wouldn’t know where to begin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m telling you where to begin. Diamondback Old West Ranch.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Detective, you’ve got to understand. That resort is the lifeblood of our little tourist town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this is political.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: No, it’s personal. Look, I’ve got people here. Folks I grew up with. And I can’t just go in and disrupt business until there’s some concrete proof.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Without the sheriff’s cooperation there’s only so much we can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re just going to let him get away with this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kind of like how we let you get away with not inviting us to the wedding?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, at least you were invited to the champagne toast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no. I’m sure it was Mr. Castle’s fault. Now, regarding the case, I’ll call the Feds and see if they can intercede on our behalf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, that could take weeks. By then any evidence or witnesses could be long gone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me, sir. I checked Whitney’s financials. She used a car service to get to the airport in Arizona this morning. And I spoke with the driver. He said she seemed upset when she left the ranch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Something happened there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but we have no way to investigate it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Maybe we do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, look at this place. I mean, it’s got beautiful skies, wide open spaces, the thrill of the old west? What better place for an impromptu honeymoon? For the investigation, of course. We could jump on a plane and be there in a few hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you cannot be serious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can find Whitney’s killer. And have a honeymoon at the same time. It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. We are not having a honeymoon at a dude ranch!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well – it could be our cover story. We’re a newlywed couple with a hankering for the wild frontier, right? And look, Beckett. I know you want to see justice brought to this young woman’s killer. And … this … this is the only way.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I hate to say this, but your husband may be right. This could be our best shot at solving the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excellent. Saddle up, honey, because we are honeymooning out west.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yee-haw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like we rolled right into a John Ford movie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay there, Hoss. Just remember we’re here for a reason: to find Whitney’s killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best honeymoon ever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eww.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is so not our honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think in the old west that was a sign of good fortune.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lucky me.

utterance.speaker: JAMES GRADY
utterance.content: Say, you all must be the newlyweds. Well, welcome to the Diamondback Old West Ranch, folks. They call me Gentleman James Grady and I’m the proprietor of this here establishment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, I am Rick, this is Kate and may I just say, this place is amazing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, very authentic.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Well that’s what you jackaroos came for, ain’t it? The legend, and dare I say, romance of the old west? Now uh, these brochures in your hands detail all the activities that we have to offer here: from cattle driving to nature walking, we’ve got it all. And my friendly staff of ranch hands, they’re the ones in red bandanas in the brochure and all around here - – they will guide you through any adventure your hearts desire. So, shall we begin?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we just got in on the redeye and were kind of hoping to check into our room.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Oh, no problem-o. Seeing as you’re newlyweds, I upgraded you to a suite in our Grand Hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well, we’re much obliged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure are, but we were looking for a more … authentic experience. We were kind od hoping to stay at one of the … bunkhouse rooms.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever the little lady wants.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: I can see who wears the ten gallon hat in your house.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and um … Mr. Grady, I know that this sounds silly, but my lucky number is fourteen. Is that room available?

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Uh … Daisy May! Daisy May! We need you, dear. That’s my missus. Like yours, she runs the show here. Uh, hun, these lovebirds want to stay in bunkhouse fourteen. Is it vacant?

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY GRADY
utterance.content: Well, sure is. But why? It’s a single room with a twin bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s okay. We’re – we’re cuddlers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Well, all righty then. But first, folks, we’ve got to get you out of those bibs and tuckers.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Woo wee. Take a look at this belvedere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do look good, don’t I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. This is like, three fantasies coming true all at one. Only thing missing is … Gentlemen James, where do we get the replica guns? Like yours.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Replica? Son, this is Arizona. It’s open carry.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Say. Do either of you two know what’s quicker than lightning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: This gun tamed the wild west. A Colt .45 single action peacemaker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I want to be him when I grow up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well yeah, if you grow up.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: It’s all about practice, which you can do with one of our firearms, available for purchase at our gift shop. In fact, why don’t we mosey on over –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Mr. Grady, you know what? Maybe later. Right now we’re both a bit knackered, so we were hoping to go to our room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: So glad you’re staying with us. Much obliged, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Much obliged, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were wrong. The key that Whitney had with her wasn’t her room key.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, what does it go to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Here’s fourteen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, wait. Whether we like it or not, we are on our honeymoon, so … we must act accordingly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, geez!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. So not our honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you looking for disinfectant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clues. Remember? Whitney was staying here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I highly doubt we’re going to find anything in this room that can help us.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Howdy, partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know if it comes with the room, but there’s a naked cowboy shaving in our bathroom.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: My fault. I forgot to lock the door. It’s a jack and jill bathroom. I’m in the room on the other side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, ok – I’m Rick. This is Kate. We just checked in. Newlyweds.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Oh, congratulations! I’m Tobias.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi. Didn’t Mr. Grady say that there was a woman staying in our room before?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh – yes. I’m surprised they let her stay so close with menfolk considering the customs of the old west.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Well, I guess when they found out that me and her both enjoyed chasing cowboys they figured what the heck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, we’re about to brew some coffee. Would you care for a cup?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: I like my coffee like I like my men: strong, black, and bitter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh, you’re fun. I bet you and your old bunkhousemate got into all sorts of trouble.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Not me. But Whitney, on the other hand, don’t get me wrong. She’s a sweetheart, but she’s a bit of a hell raiser.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Okay, like our first day here, we went on a horseback riding tour. She snuck off in the middle of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get out. Where’d she go?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Probably went to go hang out with her ranch hand. One of the red bandana boys that work here? She used to stay out with him all night, every night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like I better keep him clear of my missus. Who was this Romeo?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: I don’t know. She wouldn’t say. She just said he was tall, dark, and handsome. Oh, and married!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Married? Get out!

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I wonder if there was any trouble. I kind of think the reason we got this room is because Whitney left so early.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: She sure did. Her last night here, she rolled in at 3 AM, upset. She woke me up with all her crying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: She said she didn’t want to talk about it, she left before the sun came up. Didn’t even say goodbye. Oh, I’m late for chow. Thanks for the coffee. See you all around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An affair with a married man?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes! And she was with him until 3AM. That’s right in the middle of our time of poisoning window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve got to find this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But how? We’re undercover. I just can’t flash my badge and get people to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Which is why we don’t approach this like cops. We approach this like writers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we procrastinate and make stuff up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Well, yes. But … no. In this particular instance we approach the investigation like writers by … doing research.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now there are seven ranch hands to fit the bill of tall, dark, and handsome. But in order to figure out which one was fooling around with Whitney we have to first determine who of them are married. That means we need to go on a wedding ring search and these are the possibilities.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I split their classes up between us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa. Hold up. Harmonica for beginners? Cowboy saloon? How come you get all the cool activities and I get hogtying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because this was my idea. Though it will be a shame we’re spending the first day of our honeymoon apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except we’re not, because this is not our honeymoon. Okay, ‘bye. Be safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, wonderful. In fact, we were just discussing your nuptials.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not the actual event, since neither of us were there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, is this really why you’re calling?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Partly, yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And we have news. Here’s the good: MTA cameras show that Whitney’s bags were left on the subway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s the bad news: they were stolen by a homeless man. But we put out a BOLO. Hopefully somebody will recognize him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Also, Lanie found something during her autopsy. She found traces of a wax covered cardboard under Whitney’s nails and on the waistband of her pants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wax covered cardboard? Like … butcher paper?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Lanie says it’s too hard to tell. What about you and Hopalong? Learn anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … well, so far it looks like our victim was having an affair with a married man. But the problem is, his identity is a mystery.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, speaking of mysteries, we spoke with Whitney’s friends. They said prior to her departure she was spending a good deal of time at the historical society.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do they know what she was doing there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re still looking into it, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, guys? I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Hey, Kate! Kate! Are you going to hogtying class?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Me too! Oh my God, we’re going to have so much fun!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we sure are. Hogtying. Yee-haw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No ring. One down.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: What’ll it be, fella?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll take a coffin varnish.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Some what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, a gut warmer. Face burner. Nose paint? Cowboy cocktail? What do you all call whiskey here?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Whiskey.

utterance.speaker: MARSHALL
utterance.content: Hey, mister. I sure could use your help. I’m looking for the Peacock Boys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t seen them, Marshall, but I’ll keep an eye out.

utterance.speaker: DEALER
utterance.content: You just going to bat your eyes, mister? Or are you going to play?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Hey, I’m a – I’m a sporting man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There we go. Hey there, partner. Couldn’t help but notice you got a ring on your finger. Just had mine put on. Newlywed.

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: This isn’t a ring. It’s a noose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That bad, huh? Ooh. Yeah, I suppose one woman for the rest of your life is a tall order. What’s your secret?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: You’ll figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on. What, have you got a little left-handed missus on the side?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: I don’t cheat on my wife, friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that’s uh … not what I heard.

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: No good mangy cur! You’ve got an ace up your sleeve!

utterance.speaker: DEALER
utterance.content: You know what we do with card cheats in here, mister?

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Hold it, boys. Hear them bells? It’s high noon. That means it's show time! Take it out back. Time for a good old fashioned gunfight!

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Yee-haw!

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: What do you know? Huh? My wife send you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve never met your wife.

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: Who told you I was a cheater?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whitney did.

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: Damn it! I knew it. Look, everything that woman said to you was a lie.

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Ollie, what in tarnation? Mister, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You thought that was real? Yes! … Ollie, up high.

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: He – you asked him to throw you out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, like old west style. Ollie’s been fantastic. He’s been all yee-haw and pew-pew –

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Well, all righty then. Just as long as you’re enjoying yourself.

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: Damn. That could have cost me my job. Look, mister, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Save it. You want my silence? Tell me about Whitney. What happened between you two?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: Look, she came on to me. Started flirting, getting all handsy. A bunch of the boys saw us and figured we hooked up, but we didn’t. I swear it. In fact, I think she was just after my ranch key.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ranch key?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: A snake keychain. I think she picked it off me when she was pawing at me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does the key open?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: The ranch shed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You’re saying that she stole you key to open the ranch shed? What’s in the shed?

utterance.speaker: OLLIE
utterance.content: Nothing. Just ranch supplies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Why would Whitney steal a key to this place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but clearly it has nothing to do with the affair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So what was she after?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, do you remember how Lanie said she found traces of wax covered cardboard under Whitney’s nails and in her waistband?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you know what’s covered in wax covered cardboard? Dynamite. She broke in here to steal sticks of these.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ranchers use dynamite to clear the land. What the hell was Whitney using it for?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is there any indication why Whitney would steal dynamite?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet, but Castle and I have been retracing every move she made, starting with that horseback riding tour that she snuck away from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Any idea where she was going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I asked around and apparently the trail that she took led to the Native American reservation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait a minute, it wasn’t the Yavapai reservation, was it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. How’d you know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The historical society. Whitney was looking up obscure documents and maps from the late 18th, early 19th century.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Most of them had to do with the construction of a dam near the Yavapai reservation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, did anyone know why she was researching that area?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, but it’s probably the reason why she went out there in the first place.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But it doesn’t explain why Whitney needed dynamite or why she was poisoned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, it’s all got to be related. Castle and I are headed out to the reservation to get some answers … now. Uh … guys? I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey there. Beckett, meet the boys. This one’s Esposito and I’m calling the little one Ryan. You ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Castle, when I asked you to find us a ride I was thinking something more along the lines of a pickup truck. The reservation’s fifteen miles away. This is going to take forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, what can I tell you? Everything is authentic old west.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Couldn’t resist. You just had to get a six-shooter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right? Isn’t it great? And it gets better. I got you one, too. His and hers matching set.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who says romance dies after you say ‘I do’?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Esposito! Ryan! He-yaw!

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Seriously? You’re rolling up to the reservation dressed like extras from a Gene Autry movie? That’s some real cultural insensitivity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry. Sir, we didn’t mean any offense. We’re – we’re vacationing at Diamondback.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Yeah, I figured that. I was just messing with you folks. Relax.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He got me.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Welcome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m Rick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This here is Kate. And we are on our honeymoon. Ain’t we, honey?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we sure are. Um, so we met a guest at Diamondback. Her name was Whitney. She said that she came out here and she discovered some breathtaking views.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Yeah sure, I remember Whitney. Nice girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: She came out a few days ago riding an Appaloosa. But she wasn’t interested in the scenery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? What was she uh, … interested in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did it have anything to do with dynamite?

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Dynamite? No. She just had a question about a Yavapai word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What word was that?

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: A’hag’a’haila. She wanted to know if it could be misinterpreted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seems an odd question.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Not really. Many of our words change depending on the context. A’hag’a’haila means river, but sometimes it means stream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she want to know about that word?

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: I have no idea. But Whitney was happy with my answer. She thanked me and left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that was it? I don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: YAVAPAI ELDER
utterance.content: Yeah well, I don’t get newlyweds dressing up like cowboys on their honeymoon. But I try not to judge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the more we learn about Whitney the less I understand what she was up to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, the historical society, the Yavapai word, the dynamite. How does all of that add up to someone poisoning Whitney? It just doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what else doesn’t make sense is that we’re married. And … we’re not acting like it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh? What do you got in mind, cowboy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Admit it. You’re impressed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re right. I am. This is actually … kind of magical.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To us. To the journey and to what lies ahead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe this is our honeymoon. Hmm?

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Castle? Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your wish is my command.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m serious. Don’t move an inch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. No! No, no. No, no, no. Espo! Ryan! Come back! Guys, no! Come back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you were right before. This is so not our honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Well, thank goodness. We were fixing to put together a posse to go searching for the two of you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry, Mr. Grady. We tried to call you but we couldn’t get a signal in the hills.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Your horses came back hours ago. What happened up there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We met a namesake of your ranch.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Oh… rattler. Yeah. Well, why don’t you mosey on over to the cantina and strap on a feedbag and get some fresh jitter juice in you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I think we’ll do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, just as soon as we get on some fresh union suits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yee-haw.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You found our victim’s suitcases?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, sir. Our BOLO got a hit on the homeless guy who took them from the subway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Inside – - Whitney’s research. And something we haven’t seen before. A letter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s no return address, but it’s got an Arizona postmark dated 1992.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A twenty year old letter? “Slim, care of Rebecca Doolin”. Jersey address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re hoping to track down Ms. Doolin so we can get some answers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The letter’s from a guy named Clyde. We assume that the photograph is him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It says here that Clyde was a seasonal worker at Diamondback.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, twenty years ago before the place was a resort. But here’s the interesting part. In the letter Clyde goes on about how he and a guy named Dutch were close to figuring out some big secret.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What big secret?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, it doesn’t say. But Clyde wrote, “I just need a few more weeks, Slim. Dutch and I are so close. It all comes down to a mistranslation of a Yavapai word –“

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. A’hag’a’haila.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. How’d you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the same word Whitney was asking the Yavapai elder about.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Clyde goes on to write, “I can hardly believe it. One little old word is the key to the secret of the Peacock Boys. Soon as I find it, I’m coming on home to you. Love, Clyde.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Peacock Boys - How do I know that – They’re wanted men. Cornelius and Percy Pea – - ****.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, any idea who those people in the letter are?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but Javi’s trying to track down the lady who the letter was sent to. I’ll keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, posted. Keep – keep us – thank you. Thank you, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Eyes back in their sockets, cowboy. We’ve got a murder to solve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, who is this Clyde fellow and why did our victim have his letter? And what does any of this have to do with the Peacock Boys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good questions, and I know who has the answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The same person who always has the answers in westerns. The affable, all-knowing barkeep.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Train robbers. Held up the Southern Pacific back in 1893. Made off with fifty bars of U.S Treasury gold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gold?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Twenty-four carat AU, fella. Them Peacock Boys, they outrun a whole squad of soldiers by traversing Dead Man’s Gorge. Two days later they was gunned down just outside of Phoenix. But the gold was gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And no one knows anything about it?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: There were rumors. In 1947 missionaries started writing down the old stories of the Yavapai people. One of them was about Black Fox. Just a kid, abducted by them Peacock Boys, forced him to be their guide. But during their journey they stopped and they tied that poor Black Fox to a tree. It was just south of the river. They rode off in their gold-laden wagon. But when they returned … it was empty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Peacock Brothers stashed the gold.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: That’s what everybody thought. When the story surfaced, treasure hunters, they came a-coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anybody ever find it?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Nope. And that’s why this is just another legend of the old west.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whitney was after the gold. What if, when those missionaries wrote down Black Fox’s story, they wrote it down incorrectly? That Yavapai word has two meanings, remember. What if the Peacocks didn’t stash the gold near a river? What if they stashed it near a stream?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at these maps from Whitney’s research. In 1893 there was a stream north of the river and then in 1920 it was dammed off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, that means for all those years, everyone was looking for the gold in the wrong place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - in the wrong place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why Whitney needed the dynamite – to blast open whatever hiding place it was in. But what do you do when you discover fifty bars of gold? Fly it home in your carryon? Of course not. So she left it there, she went back to New York for help, but perhaps the killer caught on to her, poisoned her to silence her, and to keep the gold for themselves.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When she went home Whitney was upset. Does that sound like someone who just found gold?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. You got me there. But if Whitney was searching for the gold and the killer tracked her … there could be clues.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We keep assuming that the gold’s still out there. Don’t forget, Clyde and Dutch were looking for it. They might have found it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if they didn’t have those old maps that Whitney had.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just want to go after the gold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course I want to go after the gold! It’s gold! Okay, look. If we use Whitney’s research, we may find Whitney’s killer, too. Come on, Beckett. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA DOOLIN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s me. But I haven’t lived at this address in years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Rebecca, who is Slim?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: She was a friend of mine. Her real name’s Virginia Williams.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait. Does she have a daughter named Whitney?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: Virginia was pregnant with Whitney when she stayed with me. Virginia was a real mess back then.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: Knocked up, no money, no prospects. Virginia got so fed up with getting letters like these she finally wrote Clyde a dear John letter and moved on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, are you saying that Clyde is Whitney’s father?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you have any idea where Clyde is now?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: It’s been twenty years. How would I know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whitney must have found Clyde’s letters after her mother passed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and that’s what started her quest. Now … according to the map, the stream used to be right around here. I think. Maybe. I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am tracking Whitney’s path to the gold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And … how are you doing that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By staring at the dirt. That’s how they do it in all the old Westerns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, because they’re cowboys. You’re a New Yorker. An easterner. A city slicker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, and because I’m a city slicker I can tell you with absolute certainty, Whitney was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How? You don’t know how to read tracks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, no. But because I’m a New Yorker, I know how to read litter. Check this out. Charred, wax covered cardboard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whitney must have detonated the dynamite nearby. We’re close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. More there. Beckett … look at this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s gold in them there hills. You go first. Check for snakes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh ho ho. This place is old. This mine must have been abandoned before the Peacock Boys stashed their loot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Slow down, Castle. Just be careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? There’s treasure in here. Whitney found the gold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or Clyde found the gold and split it with his buddy Dutch and simply abandoned Whitney and her mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m absolutely positive Clyde didn’t find the gold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how can you be so sure, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it’s still here. For over a century, fifty ingots of pure gold have been trapped in this cold, dark tomb, waiting patiently to be rescued. You hear that, Beckett? You hear them calling?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Calling to me? Your wait is over, my golden friends. I’m here to save you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay! That’s not gold!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s blunt force trauma.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep. And given this hat, I’m pretty sure I know who the victim is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Clyde.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, do you think that Whitney came out here to find her dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it explains why she was so upset when she left. You were right. Clyde found the treasure years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but then his buddy Dutch double-crossed him. Dutch took the gold for himself, left his bloodstained shirt behind –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if he killed once, what’s to stop him from killing again to protect his secret? Wait. If Whitney found her murdered father, why not just go straight to the sheriff? Why take the first flight home?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To confront her father’s killer. Dutch was just his nickname. Castle, look. There’s a laundry tag on this shirt. It has the initials “P.D.”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Phillip Dagmar.

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with Whitney’s death.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you sure about that, Mr. Dagmar? Or should we call you Dutch?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We checked your phone records. There was a call from the ranch payphone to your cell phone the morning of Whitney’s murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She called you, didn’t she? What did she say?

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: That she was flying home. She needed to speak with me in person.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me this before?

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: Because it makes me look guilty.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re right. It does.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I bet you still got connections in that one horse town, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: Why would I kill Whitney?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because she knew about your secret, Dutch. We found Clyde’s skeleton.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The skeleton you left when you took those fifty bars of gold.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: So you’re saying that the story about the Peacock Boys and the gold is true?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yep. And someone found out the hard way.

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Well, that’s not going to be good for business.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Now don’t you worry none. All that nonsense is from long before you all bought the place. It’s not going to scare anyone off. And I’ll make sure of it.

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: I appreciate that, Sheriff.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Jimmy, I should could use the ranch’s ATVs to get up to this mine.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Of course. We’ve got two of them. They’re all yours.

utterance.speaker: DAISY MAY
utterance.content: Come on. I’ll take you to them.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Detective, would you mind showing me the way?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not a problem. Try to stay out of trouble while I’m gone, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s the fun in that?

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Sounds like you had a hell of a day, son. Want to bend an elbow and tell me all about it? Drinks are on me.

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: I did the best I could, for Whitney. All these years. But she wanted to find out what happened to her father. God, I can’t believe she found him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And when she did you knew exactly what to do, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you hired someone to poison her.

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: No, no, no. I didn’t kill Whitney. But I think I know who did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, Dutch. We know it was you.

utterance.speaker: DAGMAR
utterance.content: Clyde and I couldn’t find the location of the old stream. So we enlisted the help of someone who grew up in the town. Clyde and I planned to turn in the gold and collect the finder’s fee from the treasury. But our new partner disagreed. They fought. And Clyde fell, landed on a rock, and hit his head. He was dead in minutes. That’s when I sold my soul. For twenty five bars of gold.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mr. Dagmar, who was your other partner?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smooth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Excuse me. Ah. Ryan, they didn’t have mobile phones in the old west so you’re kind of killing the vibe. And my buzz.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, is Beckett with you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ve been calling and texting. She’s not answering.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she’s on an ATV. She probably can’t hear her phone. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There was a third partner. He’s the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Sheriff?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. It’s James Grady.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Well, I guess this is goodbye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Grady, stop.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Who’s going to make me, son? You?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, look, Grady, you uh … you kill me, that’s just another murder you’re going to have to answer for.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Not if I make it to Mexico first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t let that happen.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: You’ve got sand, boy, I’ll give you that much. Why don’t you just sit on down and have another drink. Come on, son. Think of your wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: GRADY
utterance.content: Fine. You got a hankering for a residence in the bone orchard, I’ll accommodate you. Any last words?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. If I survive this I’m giving this place a scathing review on Yelp.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! I uh, guess you got Ryan’s message.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I leave you alone for five minutes and you end up in a showdown?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well – – good thing I married the fastest gun from the east.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Given that Whitney checked in under her own name, Grady may have been on to her from the moment she arrived.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably didn’t take him long to figure out why she came.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when he did he must have followed her to the mine and seen what she discovered.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Yep. On the morning she left, Grady made specific internet searches on foxglove poisoning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like you’ve got him dead-to-rights, Sheriff.

utterance.speaker: SHERIFF
utterance.content: Well, with what you did here, we sure do. Detective, I’m in your debt. You all take care of yourselves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheriff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I guess we cleaned up this town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I reckon we did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I guess it’s time to go home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nah, nah. You know what really gets me? Is that they only invited immediate family. What, we’re not family?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: More like poor relations.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we’re probably the reason they fell in love in the first place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You know, I’ve been listening to your bellyaching for the last few days. And I have to ask, what the hell’s wrong with you two?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, sir. It doesn’t bother you?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You really want to know what I think, Detectives? I think that the two of you should stop whining like two little schoolgirls who weren’t invited to the dance and be happy that your friends, you very dear friends, have found a way to make it work. Especially after all the hell those two have been through. Now, that’s what I think.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, when you put it that way …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean, I guess in some opinions we have been kind of jerks about it, so …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yeah. You have. But, if you’re interested there might be something you can do to make it up to them.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Well, Rick, I’m sorry to see you guys go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, me too. But it couldn’t be helped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey there, cowboy. Where’re you off to in such a hurry?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, what are you doing? We’re going to miss our flight. You’ve gotta be in the office by morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you do. You don’t have any personal days left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, I kinda do. For our wedding gift Ryan and Esposito have both agreed to give me two of their vacation days each.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So now we have four days to do whatever … we … want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you want to stay here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course I want to stay. After all, this is our honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, wait. We’re still gonna go to that island getaway, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.
